text: Gaunswala is a village in Kapurthala district of Punjab State, India. It is located from Kapurthala, which is both district and sub-district headquarters of Gaunswala. The village is administrated by a Sarpanch, who is an elected representative. == Demography == According to the report published by Census India in 2011, Gaunswala has a total number of 7 houses and population of 32 of which include 13 males and 19 females. Literacy rate of Gaunswala is 80.00%, higher than state average of 75.84%. The population of children under the age of 6 years is 7 which is 21.88% of total population of Gaunswala, and child sex ratio is approximately 2500, higher than state average of 846. == Population data == {|class="wikitable sortable" !
